graph

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.Node
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable

    public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable, java.io.Serializable
    represents nodes in Graph objects.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2015

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      nodes with higher id than other nodes come first.

      copies the weights of the Node passed in, in a new hash-table, and updates the relevant max node weight values in the graph this node belongs to.

      two nodes equal each other iff they have the same id

      • addOutLink

        void addOutLink(Node t,
              java.lang.Integer linkid)
          throws ParallelException
        adds the link with id linkid as an outgoing link towards Node t.
        Parameters:
        t - Node
        linkid - Integer
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the current thread has a read-lock and there is another thread currently having a read-lock also

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Double val)
               throws ParallelException
        set the weight of the node for the property named <name> to the value val passed in the 2nd argument, and updates the relevant property's max node weight value in the graph to which this node belongs.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        val - Double
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the current thread has read-lock on the graph and there is another thread currently having a read-lock also

      • getWeightValue

        get the node value for the property named <name> in the passed argument
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Double

      • getWeightValueUnsynchronized

        public java.lang.Double getWeightValueUnsynchronized(java.lang.String name)
        get the node value for the property named <name> in the passed argument. This operation is unsynchronized, and therefore, if used in a multi- threaded context, should be externally synchronized or otherwise provide guarantees that prevent race-conditions from occurring.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Double

      • getNbors

        public final java.util.Set getNbors()
        return the neighboring nodes of this Node.
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Node>

      • getNborsUnsynchronized

        public final java.util.Set getNborsUnsynchronized()
        return the neighboring nodes of this Node. This operation is unsynchronized, and therefore, if used in a multi- threaded context, should be externally synchronized or otherwise provide guarantees that prevent race-conditions from occurring.
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Node>

      • getNbors

        public final java.util.Set getNbors(boolean force)
                             throws ParallelException
        return all immediate neighbors of this node. The returned set is a reference to the data member _nbors
        Parameters:
        force - boolean if true it forces the re-computation of the neighbors (unless a cache exists in which case the nbors are not re-computed as there is no need)
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Node>
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the current thread has read-lock on the graph and there is another thread currently owning a read-lock as well.

      • getNborIndices

        public java.util.Set getNborIndices(double val)
        return the neighboring nodes of this Node that are connected by an arc with weight greater than the value val passed in the 2nd argument.
        Parameters:
        val - double
        Returns:
        Set

      • getNborIndicesUnsynchronized

        public java.util.Set getNborIndicesUnsynchronized(double val)
        return the neighboring nodes of this Node that are connected by an arc with weight greater than the value val passed in the 2nd argument. This operation is unsynchronized, and therefore, if used in a multi- threaded context, should be externally synchronized or otherwise provide guarantees that prevent race-conditions from occurring.
        Parameters:
        val - double
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Integer nodeid>

      • getNNborIndices

        public java.util.Set getNNborIndices()
        return this Node's neighbors' indices (excluding this Node's id)
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Integer nodeid>

      • getNNborIndicesUnsynchronized

        public java.util.Set getNNborIndicesUnsynchronized()
        return this Node's neighbors' indices (excluding this Node's id). This operation is unsynchronized, and therefore, if used in a multi- threaded context, should be externally synchronized or otherwise provide guarantees that prevent race-conditions from occurring.
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Integer nodeid>

      • getNNbors

        public final java.util.Set getNNbors()
                              throws ParallelException
        return all neighbors of this node at distance 1 or 2
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Node>
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • getNNborsUnsynchronized

        public final java.util.Set getNNborsUnsynchronized()
        returns the cache member _nnbors without any locking. The method makeNNbors() must have been called in advance therefore (if by another thread, memory visibility must be ensured somehow), otherwise the result will be null or undetermined.
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Node>

      • getNNbors

        public final java.util.Set getNNbors(boolean force)
                              throws ParallelException
        return all neighbors of this node at distance 1 or 2. The returned set is a reference to the data member _nnbors. If the _nbors data member has been modified in any way (e.g. for speed-up purposes in 1-packing applications as in graph.packing.GRASPPacker, then the calling code must ensure it calls this.getNbors(true) first.
        Parameters:
        force - boolean if true it forces the re-computation of the neighbors (unless a cache exists in which case the nnbors are not re-computed as there is no need)
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Node>
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the current thread has read-lock on the graph and there is another thread currently owning a read-lock as well.

      • getInLinks

        public java.util.Set getInLinks()
        return the ids of the incoming links to this Node.
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Integer linkid>

      • getOutLinks

        public java.util.Set getOutLinks()
        return the ids of the outgoing links from this Node.
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Integer linkid>

      • getArcWeights

        public double getArcWeights()
        return the sum of all weights of all links connected to this Node (incoming and outgoing).
        Returns:
        double

      • getNborWeights

        public double getNborWeights(java.lang.String name)
                      throws ParallelException
        return the sum of all weights of all neighboring nodes of this node.
        Parameters:
        name - String the name of the weights to be aggregated.
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        ParallelException

        void copyWeightsFrom(Node n)
        copies the weights of the Node passed in, in a new hash-table, and updates the relevant max node weight values in the graph this node belongs to.
        Parameters:
        n - Node

                     throws ParallelException

      • releaseReadAccess

        private void releaseReadAccess()
                        throws ParallelException
        release the read-lock for the graph to which this node belongs. A prior getReadAccess() call on this Node object must have taken place.
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • releaseWriteAccess

        private void releaseWriteAccess()
                         throws ParallelException
        release the write-lock for the graph to which this node belongs. A prior getWriteAccess() call on this Node object must have taken place.
        Throws:
        ParallelException
